author: jon
text: 'STINKS LIKE CIGARETTES.... what kind of bakery smells of cigarettes... grosss'

author: Dom
text: 'Every year I order over a $100 worth of bread for Christmas Eve
column5: sometimes up to $200. This year it was a small order
column6: due to the pandemic of under a $100. The lady mixed up my order date for thanksgiving instead of Christmas Eve. She left a voicemail
column8: and clarified I only order bread once a year for Christmas Eve
column9: she proceeded to yell at me saying they would never take an order this far in advance for Christmas Eve. My first question every year I call is
column10: ‚Äúcan I place an order for Christmas Eve‚Äù and then we continue from there. It is a very simple mistake to confuse holiday dates
column11: whether it was the employee or customer
column12: what is not acceptable is calling customers up and then arguing with them
column13: and then saying you have to pay in full up front if you still plan to get bread on Christmas Eve
column14: as if I‚Äôm some criminal that places bread orders and doesn‚Äôt show lol. Great bread
column16: My family and I will not be coming back here.'

author: Luca De Simone
text: 'this is by far the best Italian Bakery in Hoboken.\nTry the white bread Panella (Pagnotta) and the sausage bread.\nThey also make plain italian style pizza (bread
column5: tomatoes and oregano. NO cheese).\nThe owner is from a town south of Naples and knows his stuff!'

author: Tina Russo
text: "Best Italian bread anywhere they even make sausage and pepperoni bread loaves wont buy anyone else bread I'm married 40 years and every week Dom's bread is on my table Enjoy ."

author: Chef Giusepp
text: "The best bakery in Hoboken. OLD SCHOOL!!! Hopefully you're lucky enough to get Dom to take you in the back to see the 120 year old oven. They make great bread and meat bread. BUT!! The Sfogliatell is to die for. Get there early before it's sold out!!!"

author: adam decicco
text: 'Can\'t say enough about the quality of the bread from Dom\'s. I\'ve been eating their bread since 1985. In addition
column5: you can tell when you go out to a restaurant in town
column6: whether they use Dom\'s bread. Truly a staple of quality. I serve this bread with the lunch program in Union City and the kids all rave over it. Even my Shih Tzu Abby would choose Dom\'s bread over all others for 17 years. We\'ve done the "Pepsi challenge" over many years and she takes Dom\'s every time.'

author: Laura Olivieri
text: "The smell of the fresh baked bread is something I still dream of. Big part of my childhood and it is to die for. Nothing like it anywhere else. Thank you Dom's!!!"

author: Rae Shock
column5: but the Bread and focaccia where great!'

author: Khalid Shaikh
text: 'Top notch tomato pizza bread which I am unsure is mistaken for Focaccia.  It is not formal Focaccia.  He also sells baguettes and Focaccia.  Excellent pizza bread.  Cannot get it anywhere else in the country.'

author: Dennis W.
column5: supposedly a favorite of old blue eyes himself
column7: who grew up in Hoboken.  Not sure if the old guy who's always working at the counter on weekends is Dom (or maybe Dom's son?)
column8: but he's always friendly and gets your order fast.  He may look a little grumpy
column9: but that adds to the old school character of this place.  Most importantly
column10: the quality of the bread is perfectly delicious.  Don't let the decor dissuade you.... Definitely a Hoboken institution."

author: Leonard Pollara
text: "From the skilled hands of a rare person in today's world
column6: comes the best sfogliatelle I have eaten in the world.  I travel for work and make it a point to 'follow my nose' to discover local bakeries.  Fresh bread and coffee is often my breakfast of choice. Dom's Sfogliatelle is the best by far of any other I have had anywhere else in the US
column8: and anywhere else one might find an authentic Italian style bakery.\nOrder the night before!"

author: Ivica jeljenic
text: 'Great great fresh red your choice of pepperoni
column7: I love the sausage stuffed bread play play stop by anytime'

author: John Koprowicz
text: 'Generations of family love this place...took 20 loaves of fresh Italian bread on a plane back to NC..'

author: maryann rutigliano
text: "Best focaccia!!!! I live in South Jersey and get my focaccia from only Dom's."

author: Thomas Cosma
column5: this has been our family's favorite bread."

author: Remi Hashimoto
text: 'Round semolina bread was very good. Can‚Äôt wait to try other breads!'

author: john chiovitti
text: 'Great old fashion bread store. Best quality product I have ever had and I work at a bakery. Cash only family owned business.'

author: Myles Helfand
column5: so the earlier you show up
column6: the bigger the selection you'll have to choose from -- including
column8: the best traditional Italian sfogliatelle you'll probably ever eat. (Almost all the stuff they bake is savory
column10: the lobster tails are one heck of an exception.)"

author: David Rev Ciancio
column5: the only thing for sale was french bread and tomato pies. Seems sketchy
column6: but that tomato pie was the best I've had in the area."

author: Paul Lichstein
text: 'There is a reason these guys have been around so long- they know how to make good bread.  simple ingredients plus tons of experience yeild an excellent unique product.  Nice people too.'

author: David Danho
text: 'Old school bread baking at its finest!..'

author: Gio R.
text: 'So far the best bread in New Jersey New York area. Simple ingredients flour salt yest water. Plus their tomatoes focaccia is something unique so tasty and good if you are fast in the morning before they run out. Every time I go there I make sure to buy enough bread so I can freeze'

author: Anthony Curro
column6: and briefly Italy I feel I should write about this place.  Some of the best Italian bread I have ever had!  So
column7: so good....  Don't let the appearance fool you...."

author: Armando Betancourt
text: 'you have a driving in a white van very danger today 02/14/15 @ 5 am in west new York  65 m por hours.'

author: Lynn Fortney
text: "I am so glad I walked far
column5: far away from The Tourist bakery (which is fine for what it is) to the treasure that is Dom's.  One square of Dom's tomato pie/focaccia
column6: a beautiful sfogliatelle of layers and layers of leafy pastry embracing a perfect filling of lemony ricotta
column7: and an enjoyable conversation with Esther behind the counter is a lunch experience I may never replicate. I regret not being able to try one of Dom's breads.  So much good food
